org.chrisjr.loom.mappings

Class TurtleDrawCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.chrisjr.loom.mappings.DrawCommand
      • org.chrisjr.loom.mappings.TurtleDrawCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Callable<Void>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Draw.Noop, TurtleDraw.Compound, TurtleDraw.Move, TurtleDraw.Pop, TurtleDraw.Push, TurtleDraw.Turn

    public abstract class TurtleDrawCommand
extends DrawCommand
implements Callable<Void>
    Defines the basis for a Turtle's drawing commands. The call method serves to add this command to the turtle's list, and allows these commands to be called by the scheduler through a common interface.
    Author:
    chrisjr

      • draw

        public void draw(PApplet parent)
        Description copied from class: DrawCommand
        Does the actual drawing of the shape/line/etc. Color is handled separately, so this will simply do something like call `parent.rect(0, 0, 100, 100);`.
        Specified by:
        draw in class DrawCommand
        Parameters:
        parent - the PApplet to draw to

      • draw

        public TurtleState draw(PApplet parent,
               TurtleState state)
        Draws the current command and returns an updated turtle state.
        Parameters:
        parent - the PApplet to draw to
        state - the current state of the turtle (position/heading and stack)
        Returns:
        the updated state
